block.p: Microsoft, in the first part of its appeal of an antitrust ruling against the company, accused the judge who tried the case, Thomas Penfield Jackson, of ''an array of serious substantive and procedural errors that infected virtually every aspect of the proceedings.'' In its brief, Microsoft asserted that the district court ''largely suspended application of the federal rules of evidence, admitting into evidence numerous newspaper and magazine articles and other rank hearsay.''
